intro: Chondrilla gracilis, commonly known as slender chondrilla, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to survive in drought conditions. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in a head, and the leaves are narrow and linear. Chondrilla gracilis is often found in disturbed areas and is considered a pioneer species in ecological succession.
